resources.string: Keep updates coming by rating the app, your feedback is most welcome. Try out my other Apps on Google Play.
You have less than 3 readings, the chart will show example data.
Your device does not support speech to text
Are you sure you wish to delete all the readings?
There are no readings to show. If you would like to import existing readings press the IMPORT button on the menu.
You have no readings the report will show example data.
Please purchase the Color Pack item from the Shop to unlock the background color settings.

Press the Get Backup Readings button to load your latest backup readings if available. 

Press the Import button to merge the readings into the app. 

See the help screen for further details.

Introduction

Enter your weight each day, use the chart and report screens to see how your diet is going.

Settings

Slide your finger over the settings tabs to select them:

Weight

Set your weight units such as pounds or kilograms.
Enter the weight you would like to be, this is used by the chart and report.

Height

Your height is needed for the Body Mass Index calculations which are used in your Report.
First set your length units and then enter your height.

Background Color

Personalize the app by choosing one of the exciting background.

Other

The app will automatically back up your readings every week, you can turn this feature off here.
The chart will display a trend line through your data and your target weight, you can turn these off here.

New

Enter new daily weight readings here, the date will already be set and you can also add comments. Past weight measurements can also be entered.

To enter your weight press the button displaying the weight. You can also use the -/+ buttons to adjust the weight.

Edit

Your readings are all displayed in a list with the most recent first. Press a reading to edit or delete it.

Share your readings with other apps such as Google Drive and Evernote by pressing the Share menu button.

Import readings into the app by pressing the Import menu button.

Chart

The chart displays weight changes over time. You can drag and zoom the chart using touch or by using the chart buttons.

Your weight goal is shown as a light blue horizontal line and your weight trend is shown as a red straight line going through your weight readings. See if the two lines meet, this is your target weight prediction.

Press the menu for a list of options to change the fit. You can view the last 30, 60, 90 days and 1 year from the current date, press fit all to position all your weight readings onto the chart.

Share the chart with other apps such as Facebook and Twitter by pressing the Share menu button.

Report

Displays your latest BMI, weight statistics and trends. Share the report with other apps such as Gmail by pressing the Share menu button. The report is split into 3 sections:

Body Mass Index

Shows your latest BMI measurement based on your the last weight reading and your height. The goal BMI is based upon your target weight. Ideal weight is based upon your height, see Settings for target weight and height settings.

Trends

Shows how much weight you are losing or gaining based on your weight entries for the last week, month and overall. The report will calculate when you will reach your target weight (Goal Date) based on your weight loss trends.

Stats

Shows the minimum, maximum and average weight based on all your readings. Average BMI is based on your average weight and height setting.

Advanced Topics

You can import and export your data via the menu on the Edit screen. The data is presenteded as text in a comma separated values (CSV) format for compatibility with spreadsheets.

Every week the app will back up its database to your downloads folder on your SD card. Using a file viewer app such as ASTRO File Manager you can browse to the downloads folder and open the files directly into Weight Tracker.

The imported readings are merged with the readings in the apps database, if any two readings have the same date, the imported reading will overwrite the one in the database.

When importing data, please ensure the format of the data is similar to:

92.50,2013-07-04 16:24:35,lovely day

Weight is 92.50kg, date is July 4th 2013, time is 4:24:35pm and the comment is lovely day.

*Please note that weights are expressed in kilograms, to convert to pounds multiply by 2.20462.

Weight Tracker Report
http://www.pigdogbay.com

Goal \t\t\t\t\t\t$GoalBMI

--- Trends ---

Goal Date \t\t\t\t$TrendWeekGoalDate

Last 30 Days

Goal Date \t\t\t\t$TrendMonthGoalDate

All Time

Goal Date \t\t\t\t$TrendAllGoalDate


--- Stats ---

Min Weight \t\t\t\t\t\t$MinWeight
Max Weight \t\t\t\t\t$MaxWeight
Average Weight \t\t\t\t$AverageWeight
Average BMI \t\t\t\t\t$AverageBMI
Number of Readings \t\t$Count
If you enjoy using Weight Tracker, please take a moment to rate it. Thanks for your support!
Chart showing your weight changes over time
Statistics about your weight and BMI
Change settings like the weight units
Select the weight units to use such as pounds or kilograms
Enter the weight you would like to achieve. Use the +/- buttons to adjust or press the middle button to edit.
Select the height units to use such as inches or metres
Enter your height so that your Body Mass Index can be calculated. Use the +/- buttons to adjust or press the middle button to edit.
Select the background color to use.
Show the trend line or your weight goal line on the chart
Allow automatic weekly backups of your data
You are now ready to begin tracking your weight. Press the app ICON on the top left to exit.
Tip: Press the help button on the home screen for a Quick Help Guide.
Before starting, please enter your height and weight details
